page.title: 02Traditional Medicine
page.content: Traditional medicine makes use of plants and herbs.A very old medicine is comfrey leaves for sprained and broken bones.What the so called witches of the village used to do was chew the leaves of the comfrey plant and when it was soft and mushy it was held round the ankle with a bandage.That is how comfrey earned its other name of Knitbone.The most common cure is rubbing nettle stings with dock leaves.There are lots of old remedies for warts.One of the strangest was to rub the wart with a dead frog then hang it on a tree.As the frog withered the wart did. Another one was to rub the wart with chickweed and burn the chickweed on a bonfire.One of the really unusual ones was cobwebs for wounds.I found there were lots of cures for colds including garlic,blackcurrant and honey.
